block.p: Lauren Michele Abrams, a daughter of Jamie Abrams of West Orange, N.J., and Steven Abrams of Florham Park, N.J., was married last evening to Scott Lawrence Anchin, a son of Joan and James Anchin of Armonk, N.Y. Rabbi Robert Rothman officiated at the Brae Burn Country Club in Purchase, N.Y.
The couple graduated from the University of Pennsylvania, she cum laude.

Lauren Michele Abrams, a daughter of Jamie Abrams of West Orange, N.J., and Steven Abrams of Florham Park, N.J., was married last evening to Scott Lawrence Anchin, a son of Joan and James Anchin of Armonk, N.Y. Rabbi Robert Rothman officiated at the Brae Burn Country Club in Purchase, N.Y.
The couple graduated from the University of Pennsylvania, she cum laude.

The bride, 24, is an advertising sales account manager in New York for NetZero, an Internet service provider. Her father is a director of product marketing in Springfield, N.J., for Kennametal, an industrial tool manufacturer. Her mother is a personal shopper at the Neiman Marcus store in Short Hills, N.J.

The bridegroom, 26, is an accountant at Anchin, Block & Anchin, an accounting and management consulting firm in New York. His father is a managing partner of the firm and a trustee of Penn's Wharton School. The bridegroom's mother is a docent at the Neuberger Museum of Art in Purchase.
